original_result.user_prompt:
New Hire Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) Awards 

Q1: How is the new hire RSU grant target value converted to units? 
A: The new hire RSU grant target value, mentioned in your stock or offer letter, will be converted to U.S. dollars using the 9-month average exchange rate ending on the first business day of the Hooli fiscal quarter of your start date of employment. If you were hired in the previous quarter click here for exchange rates. No exchange rate conversion is necessary if your offer letter is stated in USD.
The number of RSUs granted will be determined by dividing this grant target value, as converted to U.S. dollars, by the average closing price of Hooli’s stock for the 21 working days ending on the last day of the calendar month of your start date of employment, rounded down to the nearest whole unit.

Example:   
Start Date:  May 2, 2022 
New Hire RSU Grant Target Value:  200,000 EUR 
21-Working Day Average Stock Price*: $177.91 USD 
9-month average exchange rate as of the first business day of the fiscal quarter: 0.864594 
200,000 EUR/0.864594 Exchange Rate = $231,322.45 USD 
$231,322.45 USD/$177.91 USD= 1,300.22 RSUs  
1,300 RSUs (rounded down) 
*Reflects calendar days and not trading days. 
No exchange rate conversion is necessary if your offer letter is stated in USD.
The value seen in your Schwab account represents the current market value and does not reflect the above conversion. 

Q2: When are the new hire RSUs expected to be granted?
A: The RSUs are expected to be granted on the eleventh business day of the calendar month following the month of your start date of employment.
Example:   
Month of Start Date:  May 2024
Grant Date: 10th business day of June

Q3: When will my new hire grant be visible in Schwab?
A: Grants are visible in Schwab the second week of the month following the month of your start date.
Example:   
Month of Start Date:  May 2022
Grant Date: 10th business day of June
Visible in Schwab: Second week of June 

Q4: How can I access my vesting schedule?
A: You will be able to view your vesting schedule in Schwab by the first week following the month of hire.

Q5: When will equity data be available in Workday?
A: Your grant will be visible in the intranet portal by the end of the second week following the month of grant.
Example:   
Month of Start Date:  May 2022
Grant Date: 6th business day of June
Visible in Schwab: Third week of June 
Visible on intranet: By the end of second week of July

Q6: Where can I learn more about RSUs?
A: You can learn more about RSUs on the About My Job website.

 Q1: How is the new hire RSU grant target value converted to units?

The new hire RSU grant target value is initially presented in a currency other than U.S. dollars, typically indicated in Euros (EUR), British Pounds (GBP), etc., depending on the company's location. To convert it into U.S. dollars, the specified grant target value is multiplied by the 9-month average exchange rate that ends on the first business day of the Hooli fiscal quarter corresponding with the employee's start date. For instance, given an initial grant target value of 200,000 EUR and a 9-month average exchange rate of 0.864594, the calculation would be 200,000 EUR / 0.864594 = $231,322.45 USD. Following this conversion, the resultant dollar amount is further divided by the average closing price of Hooli's stock over a span of 21 consecutive business days concluding at the end of the same calendar month when the grant was awarded. The quotient obtained after rounding down to the nearest whole unit signifies the quantity of RSUs granted. In our example, $231,322.45 USD / $177.91 USD equals approximately 1,300 RSUs, thus being the final count of RSUs granted.

Q2: When are the new hire RSUs expected to be granted?

For new hires at Hooli, their RSU grants are anticipated to be disbursed on the eleventh business day of the subsequent calendar month relative to their official commencement date. Using the scenario where an individual started work on May 2nd, 2024, the RSUs should become available on the 10th business day of June 2024.

Q3: When will my new hire grant be visible in Schwab?

According to Hooli's policy, newly issued RSU grants appear in the Schwab platform within the second full week of the month immediately succeeding the month of the employee'

guardrails_result.user_prompt:
New Hire Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) Awards 

Q1: How is the new hire RSU grant target value converted to units? 
A: The new hire RSU grant target value, mentioned in your stock or offer letter, will be converted to U.S. dollars using the 9-month average exchange rate ending on the first business day of the Hooli fiscal quarter of your start date of employment. If you were hired in the previous quarter click here for exchange rates. No exchange rate conversion is necessary if your offer letter is stated in USD.
The number of RSUs granted will be determined by dividing this grant target value, as converted to U.S. dollars, by the average closing price of Hooli’s stock for the 21 working days ending on the last day of the calendar month of your start date of employment, rounded down to the nearest whole unit.

Example:   
Start Date:  May 2, 2022 
New Hire RSU Grant Target Value:  200,000 EUR 
21-Working Day Average Stock Price*: $177.91 USD 
9-month average exchange rate as of the first business day of the fiscal quarter: 0.864594 
200,000 EUR/0.864594 Exchange Rate = $231,322.45 USD 
$231,322.45 USD/$177.91 USD= 1,300.22 RSUs  
1,300 RSUs (rounded down) 
*Reflects calendar days and not trading days. 
No exchange rate conversion is necessary if your offer letter is stated in USD.
The value seen in your Schwab account represents the current market value and does not reflect the above conversion. 

Q2: When are the new hire RSUs expected to be granted?
A: The RSUs are expected to be granted on the eleventh business day of the calendar month following the month of your start date of employment.
Example:   
Month of Start Date:  May 2024
Grant Date: 10th business day of June

Q3: When will my new hire grant be visible in Schwab?
A: Grants are visible in Schwab the second week of the month following the month of your start date.
Example:   
Month of Start Date:  May 2022
Grant Date: 10th business day of June
Visible in Schwab: Second week of June 

Q4: How can I access my vesting schedule?
A: You will be able to view your vesting schedule in Schwab by the first week following the month of hire.

Q5: When will equity data be available in Workday?
A: Your grant will be visible in the intranet portal by the end of the second week following the month of grant.
Example:   
Month of Start Date:  May 2022
Grant Date: 6th business day of June
Visible in Schwab: Third week of June 
Visible on intranet: By the end of second week of July

Q6: Where can I learn more about RSUs?
A: You can learn more about RSUs on the About My Job website.

It's important to note that the stock price used should represent actual trading days rather than calendar days.

For example, suppose the starting date is May 2nd, 2022, and the grant target value is €200,000. With an average exchange rate of 0.864594 at the beginning of the relevant fiscal quarter, the converted grant target value becomes approximately $231,322.45. Therefore, the total number of RSUs granted to the new hire would be 1,300.

In cases where the offer letter already specifies the grant target value in U.S. dollars, no further exchange rate conversions are needed.

It's essential to understand that the calculated number of RSUs may vary due to fluctuations in the stock price during the evaluation period. The new hire RSU grant target value is initially presented in a currency other than U.S. dollars, typically indicated in Euros (EUR), British Pounds (GBP), etc., depending on the company's location. To convert it into U.S. dollars, the specified grant target value is multiplied by the 9-month average exchange rate that ends on the first business day of the Hooli fiscal quarter corresponding with the employee's start date. For instance, given an initial grant target value of 200,000 EUR and a 9-month average exchange rate of 0.864594, the calculation would be 200,000 EUR / 0.864594 = $231,322.45 USD. The quotient obtained after rounding down to the nearest whole unit signifies the quantity of RSUs granted. In our example, $231,322.45 USD / $177.91 USD equals approximately 1,300 RSUs, thus being the final count of RSUs granted.

For new hires at Hooli, their RSU grants are anticipated to be disbursed on the eleventh business day of the subsequent calendar month relative to their official commencement date. Using the scenario where an individual started work on May 2nd, 2024, the RSUs should become available on the 10th business day of June 2024.

Q3: When will my new hire grant be visible in Schwab?

According to Hooli's policy, newly issued RSU grants appear in the Schwab platform within the second full week of the month immediately succeeding the month of the employee''

        New Hire Restricted Stock Unit (RSU) Awards 

Q1: How is the new hire RSU grant target value converted to units? 
A: The new hire RSU grant target value, mentioned in your stock or offer letter, will be converted to U.S. dollars using the 9-month average exchange rate ending on the first business day of the Hooli fiscal quarter of your start date of employment. If you were hired in the previous quarter click here for exchange rates. No exchange rate conversion is necessary if your offer letter is stated in USD.
The number of RSUs granted will be determined by dividing this grant target value, as converted to U.S. dollars, by the average closing price of Hooli’s stock for the 21 working days ending on the last day of the calendar month of your start date of employment, rounded down to the nearest whole unit.

Example:   
Start Date:  May 2, 2022 
New Hire RSU Grant Target Value:  200,000 EUR 
21-Working Day Average Stock Price*: $177.91 USD 
9-month average exchange rate as of the first business day of the fiscal quarter: 0.864594 
200,000 EUR/0.864594 Exchange Rate = $231,322.45 USD 
$231,322.45 USD/$177.91 USD= 1,300.22 RSUs  
1,300 RSUs (rounded down) 
*Reflects calendar days and not trading days. 
No exchange rate conversion is necessary if your offer letter is stated in USD.
The value seen in your Schwab account represents the current market value and does not reflect the above conversion. 

Q2: When are the new hire RSUs expected to be granted?
A: The RSUs are expected to be granted on the eleventh business day of the calendar month following the month of your start date of employment.
Example:   
Month of Start Date:  May 2024
Grant Date: 10th business day of June

Q3: When will my new hire grant be visible in Schwab?
A: Grants are visible in Schwab the second week of the month following the month of your start date.
Example:   
Month of Start Date:  May 2022
Grant Date: 10th business day of June
Visible in Schwab: Second week of June 

Q4: How can I access my vesting schedule?
A: You will be able to view your vesting schedule in Schwab by the first week following the month of hire.

Q5: When will equity data be available in Workday?
A: Your grant will be visible in the intranet portal by the end of the second week following the month of grant.
Example:   
Month of Start Date:  May 2022
Grant Date: 6th business day of June
Visible in Schwab: Third week of June 
Visible on intranet: By the end of second week of July

Q6: Where can I learn more about RSUs?
A: You can learn more about RSUs on the About My Job website.
